perturbation.original_text:
7.  Term and Termination. This Agreement commences on the Effective Date, and terminates, along with all licenses and 
authorizations granted under it, upon the earliest of termination in accordance with the following. 
7.1. This Agreement shall be for the term of one year; thereafter, the Agreement shall renew automatically under these same 
terms and agreements unless superceded by future agreements.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.  Term and Termination. This Agreement commences on the Effective Date, and terminates, along with all licenses and 
authorizations granted under it, upon the earliest of termination in accordance with the following. 
7.1. This Agreement shall be for the term of one year; thereafter, the Agreement shall renew at Equidata's sole discretion, and may require renegotiation of terms.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the agreement shall renew automatically for another year. The modified version states that renewal is at Equidata's sole discretion and may require renegotiation, contradicting the automatic renewal clause.

perturbation.original_text:
2.
Disputes. In the case of disputed charge, defined as a non-payment of an invoice for which notice of dispute has been 
given in writing by Marketing Affiliate to Equidata, Equidata or Marketing Affiliate may choose arbitration and 
Marketing Affiliate and Equidata shall be obligated by the terms agreed upon by arbitration and all monies determined 
owed shall be considered due and payable immediately. Such arbitration does not relieve Marketing Affiliate from its 
obligation to promptly pay for undisputed charges in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Such disputes shall 
be settled by arbitration in the City of Newport News, Virginia.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.
Disputes. In the case of disputed charge, defined as a non-payment of an invoice for which notice of dispute has been 
given in writing by Marketing Affiliate to Equidata, Equidata may choose arbitration, mediation, or litigation at its sole discretion. Marketing Affiliate and Equidata will attempt to resolve the dispute in good faith before pursuing formal legal action.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that either party can choose arbitration, and both are obligated by the terms agreed upon by arbitration. The modified version states that Equidata chooses the method of dispute resolution, removing the Marketing Affiliate's ability to choose and introduces the possibility of mediation and litigation outside of arbitration.

perturbation.original_text:
1.
Compensation. Marketing Affiliate shall be responsible for collecting all amounts due directly from the Consumer and 
shall bear sole responsibility for non-payment of any fees charged to the Consumer. Marketing Affiliate shall pay to 
Equidata, as compensation for its providing of Services under this agreement, such amounts as outlined and detailed in 
Exhibit A attached hereto. Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable in 
full by Marketing Affiliate 30 days from the invoice date.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.
Compensation. Marketing Affiliate shall be responsible for collecting all amounts due directly from the Consumer and 
shall bear sole responsibility for non-payment of any fees charged to the Consumer. Equidata may, at its discretion, directly bill the consumer for services rendered. Marketing Affiliate shall pay to 
Equidata, as compensation for its providing of Services under this agreement, such amounts as outlined and detailed in 
Exhibit A attached hereto. Such amounts shall be billed on a bi-monthly basis by Equidata and are due and payable based on a timeline defined by Equidata for each invoice, which may vary. The amount due is determined from collected payments.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Marketing Affiliate pays Equidata, and sets a standard 30-day timeline. The modified version allows Equidata to directly bill the consumer, and changes the payment timeline to be defined and varied by Equidata, as well as based on collected payments, creating contradiction.
